baseimage.name: baseimage
baseimage.title: A minimal docker baseimage to ease creation of long-lived application containers
baseimage.description: This is a docker baseimage that can be used to create containers for any long-lived application.

release.change: Fixed the `LANG` environment variable not being set properly.
For Alpine Linux images with glibc, automatically update dynamic linker's cache after new libraries are installed.
Adjusted the way ownership of /config is taken to better support cases where the folder is mapped to a network share.
Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.2.
Upgraded glibc to version 2.26 (Alpine Linux glibc images).
Added images based on Alpine Linux 3.7.
Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.1.
Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.2.0.
Use a more efficient way to monitor status files.
Fixed an issue where a self-disabled service could be restarted.
Fixed race condition where container's exit code would not be the expected one.
Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.21.1.1.
Enhanced integration of service dependencies functionality.
Added a simple log monitor.
Added better support for service dependencies.
Services startup order is automatically determined.
Services are stopped in reverse order.
The application's service is always started last.
The following elements are no longer needed and have been removed:
`s6-svrunning` and `s6-waitdeps` programs.
Pre-stage3 with pre-finish scripts support.
Note that these changes can break building and/or execution of containers based on v1.x of this baseimage.
Restore default `/etc/shadow` during container startup.
Fixed duplicated entries in /etc/passwd and /etc/group that were created after a restart of the container.
Fixed timezone support on alpine-glibc images.
Upgraded S6 overlay to version 1.20.0.0.
Clear the environment of the container during startup.
Clear the `/tmp` folder during startup.
Make sure to remove the container shutdown indication during startup. This fixes the behavior of `KEEP_APP_RUNNING` variable after a restart of the container.
The following environment variables from the *XDG Base Directory Specification* are now set. Applications following this specification will have their configuration and data stored under `/config`.
XDG_DATA_HOME=/config/xdg/data
XDG_CONFIG_HOME=/config/xdg/config
XDG_CACHE_HOME=/config/xdg/cache

Initial release. This baseimage can be used to build containers running long-lived applications that don't require an X environment. It is the result of the split of the baseimage `jlesage/baseimage-gui`, from which all non-GUI related stuff has been moved into this new baseimage.

environment_variable.name: SUP_GROUP_IDS
environment_variable.description: Comma-separated list of supplementary group IDs of the application.

environment_variable.name: UMASK
environment_variable.description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation. By default, this variable is not set and the default umask of `022` is used, meaning that newly created files are readable by everyone, but only writable by the owner. See the following online umask calculator: http://wintelguy.com/umask-calc.pl

unraid_template.title: Umask
unraid_template.description: Mask that controls how file permissions are set for newly created files. The value of the mask is in octal notation.

environment_variable.name: TZ
environment_variable.description: [TimeZone] of the container. Timezone can also be set by mapping `/etc/localtime` between the host and the container.

environment_variable.name: KEEP_APP_RUNNING
environment_variable.description: When set to `1`, the application will be automatically restarted if it crashes or if user quits it.

environment_variable.name: APP_NICENESS
environment_variable.description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority. By default, niceness is not set, meaning that the default niceness of 0 is used. **NOTE**: A negative niceness (priority increase) requires additional permissions. In this case, the container should be run with the docker option `--cap-add=SYS_NICE`.

unraid_template.title: Niceness (priority)
unraid_template.description: Priority at which the application should run. A niceness value of -20 is the highest priority and 19 is the lowest priority.[br][b]NOTE:[/b] Setting a negative value requires additional permissions. Thus, [i][b]--cap-add=SYS_NICE[/b][/i] must be added in [i]Extra Parameters[/i] (shown when [i]Advanced View[/i] is enabled).

environment_variable.name: TAKE_CONFIG_OWNERSHIP
environment_variable.description: When set to `1`, owner and group of `/config` (including all its files and subfolders) are automatically set during container startup to `USER_ID` and `GROUP_ID` respectively.

environment_variable.name: CLEAN_TMP_DIR
environment_variable.description: When set to `1`, all files in the `/tmp` directory are delete during the container startup.
